summary: This document appears to reference the Offshore Leaks Database, which contains information on offshore entities linked to various investigations, including the Panama Papers. It discusses the database's coverage and the importance of verifying identities of individuals and entities listed within it.
keyFacts: The Offshore Leaks Database includes information on over 785,000 offshore entities.
The data covers nearly 80 years up to 2016 and links to people and companies in more than 200 countries.
The document emphasizes the importance of confirming identities based on identifiable information.
